intro: Psychotria leonardiana, commonly known as the Leonard's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but have a mild, bitter taste. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
